Gumdrop
  • All Classes
 

Uses of Class
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Server

  • Packages that use Server 
    Package Description
    org.bluezoo.gumdrop
    Core framework for the Gumdrop multipurpose Java server.
    org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ftp
    FTP (File Transfer Protocol) server implementation.
    org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http
    HTTP/1.1 and HTTP/2 server implementation.
    org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.file
    Static file serving for the HTTP server.
    org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap
    IMAP4rev2 server implementation for Gumdrop.
    org.bluezoo.gumdrop.pop3
    POP3 (Post Office Protocol version 3) server implementation.
    org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet
    Servlet 4.0 container implementation.
    org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp
    SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) server implementation.

    • Uses of Server in org.bluezoo.gumdrop

      Methods in org.bluezoo.gumdrop that return types with arguments of type Server 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.Collection<Server> Gumdrop.getServers()
      Returns the collection of TCP servers managed by this Gumdrop instance.
      java.util.Collection<Server> ParseResult.getServers()
      Returns all server components.
      Methods in org.bluezoo.gumdrop with parameters of type Server 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void Gumdrop.addServer​(Server server)
      Adds a TCP server to be managed by Gumdrop.
      void AcceptSelectorLoop.registerChannel​(Server server, java.nio.channels.ServerSocketChannel channel)
      Registers an already-bound ServerSocketChannel for a server.
      void AcceptSelectorLoop.registerServer​(Server server)
      Registers a server for accepting connections.
      void Gumdrop.removeServer​(Server server)
      Removes a TCP server from Gumdrop.
